DataElement.preferredName: Standard Toxicity Grade 3 Physiologic Resolution Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The month, day, and year the grade 3 toxicity resolved.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An adverse event experience that requires intensive therapeutic intervention and interrupts usual daily activities._Return to the normal structure and/or function, e.g. the subsidence of a pathologic process, as the subsidence of an inflammatory lesion or new growth.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An adverse event experience that requires intensive therapeutic intervention and interrupts usual daily activities.

Concepts.definition: An adverse event experience that requires intensive therapeutic intervention and interrupts usual daily activities.

Property.preferredDefinition: Return to the normal structure and/or function, e.g. the subsidence of a pathologic process, as the subsidence of an inflammatory lesion or new growth; also, the size of the smallest element that can be separated from neighboring elements. The term is used in optics, to describe imaging systems, in genetics and molecular biology, to define the degree of molecular detail on a physical map of DNA, ranging from low to high.

Concepts.definition: Return to the normal structure and/or function, e.g. the subsidence of a pathologic process, as the subsidence of an inflammatory lesion or new growth.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.
